skill.name: 1password-credential-lookup
skill.description: This skill should be used when agents need to log into websites, retrieve passwords, or access credentials. CRITICAL - always use find_credential with the website URL, never guess item names.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when agents need to log into websites, retrieve passwords, or access crede...
skill.author: ClementWalter

security_audit.summary: Legitimate credential lookup tool that uses 1Password CLI for secure retrieval. No network calls, no credential exfiltration. Subprocess calls to `op` CLI use hardcoded string arguments. Static findings are false positives triggered by expected credential access patterns.

low_findings.title: Credentials output via stdout
low_findings.description: Script outputs credentials as JSON to stdout. This is the designed behavior for credential retrieval. Not a security flaw but expected functionality.

content.value_statement: AI agents need secure access to credentials for login automation. This skill provides URL-based lookup through 1Password CLI to retrieve usernames and passwords without exposing raw secrets in prompts.
actual_capabilities: Find credentials by website URL such as github.com or twitter.com
Filter credentials by username when multiple accounts exist for a domain
Handle domain aliases such as x.com mapping to twitter.com
Return structured JSON with username, password, and item details
Provide clear error messages for missing items or multiple matches
Integrate with 1Password CLI for secure local credential retrieval
limitations: Requires 1Password CLI installed and authenticated with op signin
No MCP server integration - uses CLI directly without persistent connection
Limited to Unix-like systems with 1Password CLI support
Cannot search by arbitrary item names - must use URL field

use_cases.title: CI/CD Authentication
use_cases.description: Retrieve deployment credentials for automated pipelines without hardcoding secrets

use_cases.title: Server Access
use_cases.description: Fetch SSH keys and server passwords for infrastructure management tasks

use_cases.title: Credential Audit
use_cases.description: List and verify stored credentials across different services securely

prompt_templates.title: With Username
prompt_templates.prompt: Find credentials for github.com with username myuser

prompt_templates.title: Unknown Account
prompt_templates.prompt: List all available accounts for x.com

output_examples.input: Find credentials for github.com with username claude
List all available accounts for x.com

best_practices: Use URL-based lookup with find_credential instead of guessing arbitrary item names
Filter by username when multiple accounts exist for the same domain
Ensure 1Password CLI is signed in before requesting credentials
anti_patterns: Using item_name parameter with URLs or guessed names (item names are arbitrary and may not match domains)
Guessing item names like GitHub or my github (these do not work with the 1Password CLI)
Using get_credential with URLs instead of find_credential (violates the one rule)

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for credential retrieval workflows.

faq.question: Can I use this with multiple 1Password accounts?
faq.answer: Yes, but the script uses the default account. Filter by username to select the correct one.

faq.question: Are credentials cached or stored?
faq.answer: No caching. Each request calls 1Password CLI directly and credentials stay in memory only.

faq.question: Does this send data externally?
faq.answer: No network calls. All communication is with the local 1Password CLI installation only.

faq.question: What if multiple accounts exist for a domain?
faq.answer: The script returns a list of accounts. Add a username filter to select the correct one.

faq.question: How are credentials protected?
faq.answer: Credentials are retrieved via 1Password CLI and returned as JSON. Use environment variables to capture securely.
